alert.note: Alert for Morgan; Washington (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 06 at 9:02PM EDT until May 07 at 3:00AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: The National Weather Service in Charleston has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Morgan County in southeastern Ohio... Northwestern Washington County in southeastern Ohio... * Until 300 AM EDT. * At 902 PM EDT, radar indicated showers producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by showers. SOURCE...Radar and gauges reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Portions of Duck Creek are flooding. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Marietta, Beverly, Chesterhill, Lowell, Stockport, Macksburg, Lower Salem, Hackney and Devola. FLASH FLOOD...GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report Severe Weather to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.
